member.name: T:OneLogin.Endpoints
member.summary: Set of OneLogin Resource endpoints.

member.name: T:OneLogin.OneLoginClient
member.summary: A client class to access the OneLogin API /1 https://developers.onelogin.com/api-docs/1/getting-started/dev-overview

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The client id to connect with.
The client secret to connect with.

example.code: var client = new OneLoginClient("client id", "client secret")

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GenerateTokens
member.summary: Generate an access token and refresh token that you can use to call our resource APIs. For an overview of the authorization flow, see Authorizing Resource API Calls. Once generated, an access token is valid for 10 hours. Documentation.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetResource``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Utility method to call OneLogin GET API endpoints and deserialize response
member.typeparam: The type of the object to deserialize.
member.param: The path of the API endpoint
A dictionary of query string parameters

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetResource``1(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method to call OneLogin GET API endpoints and deserialize response
member.typeparam: The type of the object to deserialize.
member.param: The relative URL (path and optional query string) of the API endpoint

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.PostResource``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Utility method to call OneLogin POST API endpoints and deserialize response
member.typeparam: The type of the object to deserialize.
member.param: The relative URL (path and optional query string) of the API endpoint
The object to serialize

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.PutResource``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Utility method to call OneLogin PUT API endpoints and deserialize response
member.typeparam: The type of the object to deserialize.
member.param: The relative URL (path and optional query string) of the API endpoint
The object to serialize

member.summary: Utility method to call OneLogin DELETE API endpoints and deserialize response
member.typeparam: The type of the object to deserialize.
member.param: The relative URL (path and optional query string) of the API endpoint

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.CreateRequest(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Object)
member.summary: Create a with Authentication and Json media type headers.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.CreateRequest(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod)
member.summary: Create a with Authentication and Json media type headers.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetEventTypes
member.summary: This call returns a list of all OneLogin event types available to the Events API, providing event type names, event type IDs, and descriptions.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetEvents(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: An event that was recorded in OneLogin.
member.param: Client ID used to generate the access token that made the API call that generated the event.
Time and date at which the event was created. This value is autogenerated by OneLogin.
Type of event triggered.
Event’s unique ID in OneLogin. Autogenerated by OneLogin.
ID of the user that was acted upon to trigger the event.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetEventById(System.Int64)
member.summary: An event that was recorded in OneLogin.
member.param: Set to the id of the event that you want to return. If you don’t know the event’s id, use the Get Events API call to return all events and their id values.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.CreateEvent(OneLogin.Requests.CreateEventRequest)
member.summary: Use to create an event in the OneLogin event log. From individual user actions, to administrative operations, provisioning, and OTP device registration, everything that happens within your OneLogin account can be tracked.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetGroups
member.summary: Use to get a list of groups that are available in your account. The call returns up to 50 groups per page.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetGroup(System.Int32)
member.param: Set to the group’s ID with .xml appended. For example, 123456.xml. If you don’t know the group’s id, use the Get all groups API call to return all groups and their id values.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GenerateInviteLink(System.String)
member.summary: Generate an invite link for a user that you have already created in your OneLogin account.
member.param: Set to the email address of the user that you want to generate an invite link for.
member.returns: Provide the link to the user to enable her to set her password and then access your OneLogin portal.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.SendInviteLink(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Send an invite link to a user that you have already created in your OneLogin account.
member.param: Set to the email address of the user that you want to generate an invite link for.
If you want to send the invite email to an email other than the one provided in email, provide it here. The invite link will be sent to this address instead.
member.returns: The user can click the link to set his password and access your OneLogin portal.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetAvailableAuthenticationFactors(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this API to return a list of authentication factors that are available for user enrollment via API.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.EnrollAnAuthenticationFactor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this API to enroll a user with a given authentication factor. If the authentication factor requires confirmation to complete, then the device will have an active state of false otherwise it will have an active state of true (corresponding to devices that are either pending confirmation or not) To change the active state of the device to true, the OTP device’s id would need to be supplied to the Activate a Factor endpoint.Then the `otp_code` would need to be sent to the Verify a Factor endpoint.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
The identifier of the factor to enroll the user with.
A name for the users device
The phone number of the user in E.164 format.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetEnrolledAuthenticationFactors(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this API to return a list of authentication factors registered to a particular user for multifactor authentication (MFA). The list includes devices that are enabled (used successfully for authentication at least once) or pending enablement (registered but never used). This API is typically used in a login workflow in which MFA is required, providing the user a selection of their registered MFA devices to choose from. The returned list represents the authentication factors that have been registered by the user on their Profile page or on the OneLogin login page or custom login page.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.ActivateAnAuthenticationFactor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this API to return a list of authentication factors registered to a particular user for multifactor authentication (MFA). The list includes devices that are enabled (used successfully for authentication at least once) or pending enablement (registered but never used). This API is typically used in a login workflow in which MFA is required, providing the user a selection of their registered MFA devices to choose from. The returned list represents the authentication factors that have been registered by the user on their Profile page or on the OneLogin login page or custom login page.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
Set to the device_id of the MFA device.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.VerifyAnAuthenticationFactor(System.Int32,System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.VerifyAnAuthenticationFactorRequest)
member.summary: Use this API to authenticate a one-time password (OTP) code provided by a multifactor authentication (MFA) device. If this is the first time that the OTP device has been confirmed, then the device will be updated to have a state of enabled.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
Set to the device_id of the MFA device.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.RemoveAFactor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this API to authenticate a one-time password (OTP) code provided by a multifactor authentication (MFA) device. If this is the first time that the OTP device has been confirmed, then the device will be updated to have a state of enabled.
member.param: Set to the id of the user.
Set to the device_id of the MFA device.
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetRole(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this call to get a role by ID.
member.param: Set to the id of the role that you want to return. If you don’t know the role’s id, use the Get Roles API call to return all roles and their id values.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetRoles
member.summary: This call returns up to 50 roles per page.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetUsers(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get all of the users registered with OneLogin filtered by the given parameters. https://developers.onelogin.com/api-docs/1/users/get-users
member.returns: Returns the serialized as an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetUserById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the Onelogin user.
member.param: the id of the user that you want to return.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetAppsForUser(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a list of apps accessible by a user, not including personal apps. https://developers.onelogin.com/api-docs/1/users/get-apps-for-user
member.param: Set to the id of the user that you want to return.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetRolesForUser(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a list of role IDs that have been assigned to a user.
member.param: Set to the id of the user for which you want to return a list of assigned roles.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.GetCustomAttributes
member.summary: Returns a list of all custom attribute fields (also known as custom user fields) that have been defined for your account.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.CreateUser(OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest)
member.summary: Creates a onelogin user account.
member.param: The request object.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.UpdateUserById(System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.UpdateUserByIdRequest)
member.summary: Updates a onelogin user account.
member.param: Set to the id of the user which you want to update.
The request object.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.AssignRoleToUser(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Assign one or more existing roles to a user.
member.param: Set to the id of the user to which you want to assign a role. If you don’t know the user’s id, use the Get Users API call to return all users and their id values.
An array of one or more role IDs. The IDs must be positive integers.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.RemoveRoleFromUser(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Remove one or more existing roles from a user. This API will not remove roles that were added to a user via mapping or provisioning.
member.param: Set to the id of the user for whom you want to remove a role. If you don’t know the user’s id, use the Get Users API call to return all users and their id values.
An array of one or more role IDs. The IDs must be positive integers.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.SetPasswordByIdUsingCleartext(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initially set or subsequently change a user’s password. Note that setting a user password using cleartext via this API is comparable to using our in-browser, form-based Change Password functionality on top of an encrypted channel. Note also that when you set a password via this API, the password change must comply with your third-party user directory’s password policy for the user.
member.param: Set to the id of the user for which you want to set or reset a password. If you don’t know the user’s id, use the Get Users API call to return all users and their id values.

Set to the password value using cleartext. Hashes are never stored as cleartext. They are stored securely using cryptographic hash. OneLogin continuously upgrades the strength of the hash. Ensure that the value meets the password strength requirements set for the account.
Defaults to false. This will validate the password against the users OneLogin password policy.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256(System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256)
member.summary: Initially set or subsequently change a user’s password. Note that this API cannot verify that the password value supplied meets the password complexity requirements set for the user’s account.If this is a concern, and you use a third-party directory like AD or LDAP, you can use the cleartext version of this API, which can update the password in a third-party directory directly, and enforces the password complexity requirements of the third-party directory.
member.param: Set to the id of the user for which you want to set or reset a password. If you don’t know the user’s id, use the Get Users API call to return all users and their id values.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.SetCustomAttributeValue(System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.SetCustomAttributeRequest)
member.summary: Set a custom attribute field (also known as a custom user field) value for a user. The custom attribute field must exist for your account.For details about defining custom user fields in OneLogin, see Custom User Fields.
member.param: Set to the id of the user for whom you want to set custom attribute values. If you don’t know the user’s id, use the Get Users API call to return all users and their id values.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.SetUserState(System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.SetUserStateRequest)
member.summary: Set the State for a user. States describe a stage in a process(such as user account approval). User state determines the possible statuses a user account can be in.
member.param: Set to the id of the user whose state you want to update.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.LogUserOut(System.Int32)
member.summary: Log a user out of any and all sessions.
member.param: Set to the id of the user that you want to log out.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.LockUserAccount(System.Int32,OneLogin.Requests.LockUserAccountRequest)
member.summary: Log a user out of any and all sessions.
member.param: Set to the id of the user that you want to log out.

member.name: M:OneLogin.OneLoginClient.DeleteUserById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this call to delete a user by ID.
member.param: Set to the id of the user that you want to log out.

member.summary: Assign one or more existing roles to a user.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.AssignRoleToUserRequest.RoleIds
member.summary: Set to an array of one or more role IDs. The IDs must be positive integers.

member.summary: Create an event in the OneLogin event log.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateEventRequest.EventTypeId
member.summary: Set to the ID of the event type you want to create. For a list of valid event type IDs, see Event Resource and Types.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateEventRequest.AccountId
member.summary: Set to your account ID.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateEventRequest.ActorUserId
member.summary: Value must exist in OneLogin.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Requests.CreateSessionLoginToken
member.summary: Use this API to generate a session login token in scenarios in which MFA may or may not be required. Both scenarios are supported. A session login token expires two minutes after creation.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateSessionLoginToken.UsernameOrEmail
member.summary: Set to the username or email of the user that you want to log in.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateSessionLoginToken.password
member.summary: Set to the password of the user that you want to log in.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateSessionLoginToken.subdomain
member.summary: Set to the subdomain of the user that you want to log in. For example, if your OneLogin URL is splinkly.onelogin.com, enter splinkly as the subdomain value.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest
member.summary: Set of fields to be sent when creating a user. https://developers.onelogin.com/api-docs/1/users/create-user

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.Email
member.summary: User’s email address, which he also uses to log in to OneLogin.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.Username
member.summary: If the user’s directory is set to authenticate using a user name value, this is the value used to sign in.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.FirstName
member.summary: User’s first name.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.Department
member.summary: The Department the user belongs to.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.GroupId
member.summary: Group to which the user belongs.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.InvalidLoginAttempts
member.summary: Number of sequential invalid login attempts the user has made that is less than or equal to the Maximum invalid login attempts value defined on the Session page in OneLogin. When this number reaches this value, the user account will be locked for the amount of time defined by the Lock effective period field on the Session page and this value will be reset to 0.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.LastName
member.summary: User’s last name.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.OpenIdName
member.summary: OpenID URL that can be configured in other applications that accept OpenID for sign-in.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.LocaleCode
member.summary: Represents a geographical, political, or cultural region. Some features may use the locale value to tailor the display of information, such as numbers, for the user based on locale-specific customs and conventions.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.Phone
member.summary: User’s phone number.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.DistinguishedName
member.summary: Synchronized from Active Directory.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.ExternalId
member.summary: External ID that can be used to uniquely identify the user in another system.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.DirectoryId
member.summary: ID of the directory (Active Directory, LDAP, for example) from which the user was created.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.MemberOf
member.summary: Synchronized from Active Directory.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.SamAccountName
member.summary: Synchronized from Active Directory.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.UserPrincipalName
member.summary: Synchronized from Active Directory.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.CreateUserRequest.ManagerAdId
member.summary: ID of the user’s manager in Active Directory.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingCleartextRequest
member.summary: Request to set a users's password with cleartext.

member.summary: Set to the password value using cleartext.

member.summary: Ensure that this value matches the password value exactly.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingCleartextRequest.ValidatePolicy
member.summary: Defaults to false. This will validate the password against the users OneLogin password policy.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256
member.summary: Request to set a users' password with a salt and hashed code.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256.Password
member.summary: Set to the password value using a SHA-256-encoded value. If you are including your own password_salt value in your request, prepend the salt value to the cleartext password value before SHA-256-encoding it.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256.PasswordConfirmation
member.summary: This value must match the password value.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256.PasswordAlgorithm
member.summary: Set to salt+sha256.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Requests.SetPasswordByIdUsingSaltAndSHA256.PasswordSalt
member.summary: Optional. If your password hash has been salted then you can provide the salt used in this param. This assumes that the salt was prepended to the password before doing the SHA256 hash. The API supports a salt value that is up to 40 characters long.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.ActivateAnAuthenticationFactorResponse
member.summary: Use this API to trigger an SMS or Push notification containing a One-Time Password (OTP) that can be used to authenticate a user with the Verify Factor call. It is only necessary to activate a factor if needs_trigger is returned as true via the Enroll Factor or Get Enrolled Factors calls.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor
member.summary: OneLogin provides a series of API endpoints that let you manage MFA for your users. You can enroll multi-factor devices, trigger the sending of One-Time Password (OTP) codes via SMS or Push notification and, Verify codes to authenticate users.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.UserDisplayName
member.summary: Authentication factor display name assigned by users when they register the device.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.Active
member.summary: true = enabled (used successfully for authentication at least once). false = pending (registered but never used).

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.StateToken
member.summary: A short lived token that is required to Verify the Factor. This token expires in 120 seconds.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.AuthFactorName
member.summary: "Official" authentication factor name, as it appears to administrators in OneLogin.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.TypeDisplayName
member.summary: Authentication factor display name as it appears to users upon initial registration, as defined by admins at Settings > Authentication Factors.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.Id
member.summary: User identifier

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.ActivatedFactor.DeviceId
member.summary: MFA device identifier.

member.summary: A base class for all responses that have returnable data.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.BaseResponse`1.Data
member.summary: Collection of data returned by the API service.

member.summary: The base class for all responses that have a status element.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.BaseStatusResponse.Status
member.summary: The status of the request.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.EmptyResponse
member.summary: Response message containing the status of the request.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.EnrollAnAuthenticationFactorResponse
member.summary: If the authentication factor requires confirmation to complete, then the device will have an active state of false otherwise it will have an active state of true (corresponding to devices that are either pending confirmation or not)

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor
member.summary: OneLogin provides a series of API endpoints that let you manage MFA for your users. You can enroll multi-factor devices, trigger the sending of One-Time Password (OTP) codes via SMS or Push notification and, Verify codes to authenticate users.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.Active
member.summary: True = enabled (used successfully for authentication at least once). False = pending (registered but never used).

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.Default
member.summary: True = is user’s default MFA device for OneLogin.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.StateToken
member.summary: A short lived token that is required to Verify the Factor. This token expires in 120 seconds

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.AuthFactorName
member.summary: "Official" authentication factor name, as it appears to administrators in OneLogin.
member.value: The name of the auth factor.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.PhoneNumber
member.summary: For OTP codes sent via SMS, the phone number receiving the SMS message.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.TypeDisplayName
member.summary: Authentication factor display name as it appears to users upon initial registration, as defined by admins at Settings > Authentication Factors.
member.value: The name of the type display.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.NeedsTrigger
member.summary: true: You MUST Activate this Factor to trigger an SMS or Push notification before Verifying the OTP code. false: No Activation required.You can Verify the OTP immediately. MFA factors that provide both push notifications (user accepts notification) and pull code submission(user initiates code submission from device or enters it manually) should appear twice; once with needs_trigger: true and once with needs_trigger: false.
member.value: true if needs trigger; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.UserDisplayName
member.summary: Authentication factor display name assigned by users when they enroll the device.
member.value: The name of the user display.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.AuthenticationFactor.Id
member.summary: MFA device identifier.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.GenerateInviteLinkResponse
member.summary: Provide the link to the user to enable her to set her password and then access your OneLogin portal. Documentation

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.GenerateTokensResponse
member.summary: Serialized response to generating a token. Documentation

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.Token
member.summary: An access token has a rate limit of 5,000 calls per hour. If an access token surpasses this limit, API calls will return an error. After the hour has passed, the count will be reset to a full 5,000 available calls.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.AccessToken
member.summary: Provides the requested access token. You can use this token to call our resource APIs.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.CreatedAt
member.summary: Time at which the access token was generated.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.ExpiresIn
member.summary: Indicates that the generated access token expires in 36,000 seconds, 600 minutes, or 10 hours. An expired access token cannot be used to make resource API calls, but it can still be used along with its associated Refresh Token to call the Refresh Tokens API.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.RefreshToken
member.summary: Provides the refresh token that is uniquely paired with the access token. You can use this token to request a refresh to its associated access token. For more information about refreshing access tokens, see Refresh Token.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.TokenType
member.summary: Indicates that the generated access token is a bearer token.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Token.AccountId
member.summary: Account ID associated with the API credentials used to generate the token.

member.summary: Get a list of apps accessible by a user, not including personal apps. To get a list of apps accessible by a user to embed in your company intranet, for example, see Get Apps to Embed for a User. https://developers.onelogin.com/api-docs/1/users/get-apps-for-user

member.summary: Indicates whether the app requires the OneLogin browser extension to login.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.UserApps.LoginId
member.summary: User’s ID in the app. For example, in one app the user’s ID may be georgia.wong@company.com, but in another it may be georgia.wong.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.UserApps.Personal
member.summary: Indicates whether the app is a user’s personal app.

member.summary: User’s unique ID in OneLogin.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.InvalidLoginAttempts
member.summary: Number of sequential invalid login attempts the user has made that is less than or equal to the Maximum invalid login attempts value defined on the Session page in OneLogin. When this number reaches this value, the user account will be locked for the amount of time defined by the Lock effective period field on the Session page and this value will be reset to 0.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.InvitationSentAt
member.summary: Date and time at which an invitation to OneLogin was sent to the user.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.LastLogin
member.summary: Date and time of the user’s last login.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.LastName
member.summary: User’s last name.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.LockedUntil
member.summary: Date and time at which the user’s account will be unlocked.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.Comment

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.OpenIdName

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.User.LocaleCode
member.summary: Represents a geographical, political, or cultural region. Some features may use the locale value to tailor the display of information, such as numbers, for the user based on locale-specific customs and conventions.

member.name: T:OneLogin.Responses.Pagination
member.summary: When you call a resource API, the response message will include a pagination element like the one shown here:

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Pagination.BeforeCursor
member.summary: You can use the before_cursor value as a query parameter to retrieve the previous page of results.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Pagination.AfterCursor
member.summary: You can use the after_cursor value as a query parameter to make a call to retrieve the next page, or set, of results.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Pagination.PreviousLink
member.summary: The previous_link value provides a premade request URL for your convenience.

member.name: P:OneLogin.Responses.Pagination.NextLink
member.summary: The next_link value provides a premade endpoint URL using the after_cursor value, for your convenience.
